thread.title: Murray, Carroll lead Eagles to 27-7 win over Giants
thread.title_full: Murray, Carroll lead Eagles to 27-7 win over Giants

title: Murray, Carroll lead Eagles to 27-7 win over Giants
text:
Updated: 11:51 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 | Posted: 11:42 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 Murray, Carroll lead Eagles to 27-7 win over Giants Related View Larger Philadelphia Eagles tight end Zach Ertz (86) is tackled by New York Giants middle linebacker Uani' Unga (47) and free safety Landon Collins (21) during the first half of an NFL football game Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Philadelphia. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke) View Larger New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning, bottom, is sacked by Philadelphia Eagles defensive end Vinny Curry, center, as linebacker Connor Barwin dives in during the first half of an NFL football game, Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Philadelphia. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke) View Larger Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver Riley Cooper, left, makes a touchdown catch on a pass from quarterback Sam Bradford, not pictured, as New York Giants strong safety Brandon Meriweather defends during the first half of an NFL football game, Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Philadelphia. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke) View Larger New York Giants cornerback Jayron Hosley (28) is tripped up by Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver Josh Huff (13) after Hosley intercepted a pass from quarterback Sam Bradford during the first half of an NFL football game Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Philadelphia. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke) Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver Josh Huff, left, tries to avoid a hit by New York Giants strong safety Brandon Meriweather during the first half of an NFL football game, Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Philadelphia. (AP Photo/Michael Perez) Sponsored Links The Associated Press PHILADELPHIA â€” 
DeMarco Murray ran for 109 yards and a touchdown, Nolan Carroll returned one of Eli Manning's two interceptions for a score and the Philadelphia Eagles beat the New York Giants 27-7 Monday night. 
Sam Bradford threw for 280 yards and a 32-yard TD pass to Riley Cooper, but had three interceptions to keep New York in the game. 
The Eagles (3-3) have won two straight to move from last place in the NFC East into a tie for first with the Giants (3-3). The teams meet again in Week 17. 
Neither team looked sharp in front of a prime-time audience. They combined for seven turnovers and 21 penalties. 
The Giants gave the Eagles first downs on a roughing-the-passer penalty and a running-into-the-kicker penalty to keep both of their TD drives going.
